jinngine.geometry.contact
Interface ContactGenerator

All Known Implementing Classes:
BulletNativeContactGenerator, SphereContactGenerator, SupportMapContactGenerator, SupportMapSphereContactGenerator
public interface ContactGenerator

A contact generator is used by the ContactConstraint to generate its contact information. ContactGenerator encapsulates all geometry and algorithm specific details. Therefore, it is the responsibility of the simulator (Model) to instantiate correct implementations of ContactGenerators, when various types of geometries in proximity are encountered during simulation. A ContactConstraint can handle one or more ContactGenerators. This allows for bodies in the simulation, which have more than one geometry instance attached.

Nested Class Summary
static class ContactGenerator.ContactPoint
          A simple structure class representing a contact point with a normal and a penetration depth
 
Method Summary
 java.util.Iterator<ContactGenerator.ContactPoint> getContacts()
          Get all contact points generated by this contact generator
 void remove()
          Called when this ContactGenerator is being removed from the ContactConstraint (or some other user).
 void run()
          Run/update contact generation.
 

Method Detail

run

void run()
Run/update contact generation. This method will be invoked by the ContactConstraint, to update the contact information, to reflect the present configuration. An implementation should run all necessary computations during this call, and generate all contact points, as to be returned by getContacts().

getContacts

java.util.Iterator<ContactGenerator.ContactPoint> getContacts()
Get all contact points generated by this contact generator

Returns:
An iterator of ContactPoints

remove

void remove()
Called when this ContactGenerator is being removed from the ContactConstraint (or some other user). This method can be used to perform clean-up if needed.
